revised_title: Anatomical Investigations of the Medulla Oblongata and Spinal Marrow
tldr: The author, Sir Charles Bell, investigates the structure and function of the medulla oblongata and spinal marrow, focusing on the arrangement and connections of the nerves within these regions. He describes the separation of the spinal cord's columns and the role of cinerial matter in their organization, as well as the union of the lateral columns in the medulla oblongata and their connection to the cerebrum.
